thread.title: Antonio Conte expected to sign new deal and warns Premier League rivals that Chelsea will be even better next season
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte expected to sign new deal and warns Premier League rivals that Chelsea will be even better next season

author: simon johnson
title: Antonio Conte expected to sign new deal and warns Premier League rivals that Chelsea will be even better next season
text:
Chelsea's winning run in the Premier League under Antonio Conte 1/14 
Chelsea's winning run under Antonio Conte Getty Images 2/14 Hull City 0 Chelsea 2 | October 1 Getty Images 3/14 Chelsea 3 Leicester City 0 | October 15 Getty Images 4/14 Chelsea 4 Manchester United 0 | October 23 AFP/Getty Images 5/14 Southampton 0 Chelsea 2 | October 30 AFP/Getty Images 6/14 Chelsea 5 Everton 0 | November 5 Getty Images 7/14 Middlesbrough 0 Chelsea 1 | November 20 Lindsey Parnaby/AFP/Getty Images 8/14 Chelsea 2 Tottenham 1 | November 26 AFP/Getty Images 9/14 Manchester City 1 Chelsea 3 | December 3 Getty Images 10/14 Chelsea 1 West Brom 0 | December 11 AFP/Getty Images 11/14 Sunderland 0 Chelsea 1 | December 14 Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images 12/14 Crystal Palace 0 Chelsea 1 | December 17 AFP/Getty Images 13/14 Chelsea 3 Bournemouth 0 | December 26 AFP/Getty Images 14/14 Chelsea 4 Stoke 2 | December 31 Chelsea FC via Getty Images 
Antonio Conte has warned Chelsea ’s Premier League rivals that his side will be even better next season. 
Chelsea have dominated the title race for the past four months and need just 21 points from their last 10 League matches to bring the title back to Stamford Bridge. 
It is a remarkable turnaround for the Blues, who finished 10th last term - their lowest position for 20 years. 
This is Conte's first campaign in charge having taken over only last summer and the Italian suggests there is a lot more to come from his side. Kante: I don’t feel like the best player in the Premier League 
He said: "This is the first season for me at Chelsea and for sure when you have the possibility to work more years with the team you can improve, you must improve. It's normal. 
"This season is very important because my players are understanding my idea of football. They are adapting to my system, to my philosophy of football. We are building something important. 
Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images 
"I think my players are fully in my idea of football, fully in the method. When I arrived as a new coach in a new team, you must know your players and have a bit of time to understand the habits, and then to bring them to your idea - but also to show them that your idea is a positive." The players on Chelsea’s transfer shortlist The players on Chelsea’s transfer shortlist 1/17 
The players on Chelsea's wishlist... Lindsey Parnaby/AFP/Getty Images
